subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1847
msgSnippet: ... For my money the role of QA is more in the writing of system and acceptance tests than unit tests.  I have no problem with giving QA the role of assuring
messageBody:
On Jun 2, 2006, at 4:01 AM, junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> At the very least, I expect developers to write "passing" tests for
> their
> code, but after this, it's quite common to see these tests passed
> along to
> QA which will expand on them and bring their own mindset and
> experience.

For my money the role of QA is more in the writing of system and
acceptance tests than unit tests. I have no problem with giving QA
the role of assuring that the system meets the requirements.
However, I think it is each programmers professional duty to ensure
that every line of code that they write does what they think it will do.

----
Robert C. Martin (Uncle Bob) | email: unclebob@...
